item.title: Low Emission Building Control with Zero-Shot Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Scott R. Jeen\(^{1,3}\), Alessandro Abate\(^{2,3}\), Jonathan M. Cullen\(^{1}\) \(^{1}\) University of Cambridge \(^{2}\) University of Oxford \(^{3}\) Alan Turing Institute [Paper] [View Code on GitHub] [Talk] Presenting PEARL: Probabilistic Emission-Abating Reinforcement Learning, a deep RL algorithm that can find performant building control policies online, without pre-training–the first time this has been shown to be possible. We show PEARL can reduce annual emissions by 31% when compared with a conventional controller whilst maintaining thermal comfort, and outperforms all RL baselines used for comparison.
